message: Bob, I'm excited to offer you this product, which I believe will be incredibly valuable to your business. My initial price is $950,000. I'm confident we can find a mutually beneficial agreement.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $800,000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value to me.

Bob, I understand your perspective, but $800,000 is significantly below what the product is worth to me. To bridge the gap, I'm willing to come down to $900,000. This price still allows me to achieve a reasonable profit while offering you a significant value proposition.  Let's keep the conversation going.
I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $900,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you in the middle at $850,000. This price seems more reasonable to me.

Bob, I appreciate your counteroffer, but $850,000 is still too low for me. Let's find a solution that works for both of us. I'm willing to go down to $875,000.  This price reflects the significant value this product will bring to your business while still allowing me to meet my financial goals.
I understand your desire to meet your financial goals, but $875,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you halfway at $825,000. This price seems more reasonable to me.

Bob, I appreciate your willingness to negotiate further.  While $825,000 is still lower than my desired price, I am willing to go down to $850,000 to close this deal. This price point offers us both a good outcome. Let's make this happen.

I appreciate your willingness to negotiate, but $850,000 is still a bit above my budget. I'm willing to meet you at the lowest price you're willing to sell it for, which is $800,000. I believe this is a fair price for both of us.
